result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant AND Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court prior to case being called, defendant Marcelo Francisco Aranguiz-Soto not in court, in custody in a US Marshalls ICE hold.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Marcelo Francisco Aranguiz-Soto not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  JUDGE BOROWSKI, BRANCH 12 FOR JUDGE PROTASIEWICZ, BRANCH 24.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Marcelo Francisco Aranguiz-Soto not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Marcelo Francisco Aranguiz-Soto not in court, in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter:  Brenda Barthlomew.  Pretrial conference conducted.  Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Best Buy Stores

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
